Class ImprovedStackImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ImprovedStackImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImprovedStack, Stack

    public class ImprovedStackImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImprovedStack
    An implementation of a stack with additional methods. Classes implementing this interface must use a List as the underlying data structure to store the elements on the stack. Not all operations on a stack will always be successful. For example, a programmer may try to pop an element from an empty stack. Since we hace not covered exceptions yet, we need another mechanism to report errors. In order to do that, methods of this list will return a ReturnObject that will contain either an object or an error value of the right kind (as defined in ErrorMessage). Implementation by Chris Grocott, original interface by PiJ team

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImprovedStackImpl()
      No argument constructor creates an empty stack

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the stack is empty, false otherwise.
      ReturnObject pop()
      Returns the element at the top of the stack.
      void push(java.lang.Object item)
      Adds an element at the top of the stack.
      void remove(java.lang.Object object)
      Removes the given object from the stack if it is there.
      ImprovedStack reverse()
      Returns a copy of this stack with the items reversed, the top elements on the original stack is at the bottom of the new stack and viceversa.
      int size()
      Returns the number of items currently in the stack.
      ReturnObject top()
      Returns the element at the top of the stack.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string consisting of the elements of the stack separated by commas.

        public ReturnObject top()
        Returns the element at the top of the stack. The stack is left unchanged.
        Specified by:
        top in interface Stack
        Returns:

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Object object)
        Removes the given object from the stack if it is there. Multiple instances of the object are all removed. Classes implementing this method must use method .equals() to check whether the item is in the stack or not.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface ImprovedStack
        Parameters:
        object - the object to remove
